data.title: Chief executive Sam Rush extends Derby stay
data.meta_description: Derby president and chief executive Sam Rush has penned a five-year contract with the club.
data.text:
Rush has been with the Rams since January 2013 having joined from Wasserman Media Group and has now committed his long-term future to the club.

Chairman Mel Morris told the club's official website: "I am thrilled that Sam Rush has committed his future to Derby County Football Club by signing this new contract.

"Sam's arrival was a key part of a big turnaround for this club and he has contributed hugely to where we find ourselves today.

"He was one of the main reasons why I wanted to get involved in May 2014 and for him to remain with us for the long-term is excellent news for everyone connected with the club.

"We have a very good working relationship and I am looking forward to working closely with Sam long into the future.

"Like myself, Sam has a huge desire to try and help this club get back to where we believe it belongs and that's in the Premier League."
